text: Paula Atherton is an American jazz saxophonist. ==Career== Born and raised in Massapequa Park, Long Island, NY, Atherton began playing the flute at the age of nine and then the saxophone during her teen years. She became further interested in jazz soon afterwards. As a jazz vocalist/musician, Atherton was influenced by artistes such as Billie Holiday, Charlie Parker, Cannonball Adderley and David Sanborn. ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Single !| Chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:40px;"| US Jazz |- | rowspan="2"| 2013 | style="text-align:left;"| "Sassy Strut" | 15 |- | style="text-align:left;"| "Herbie" | 21 |- || 2016 | style="text-align:left;"| "Between You & Me" | 21 |- || 2017 | style="text-align:left;"| "Girl Talk" (Cindy Bradley feat. Paula Atherton) | 2 |- || 2018 | style="text- align:left;"| "My Song for You" | 18 |} ==References== Category:American jazz saxophonists Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people
